meanings.definition: To strongly encourage or persuade someone to do something beyond what is reasonable or necessary.
meanings.sent1: She overurged her friend to eat the entire cake, even though it was too much for one person.
meanings.sent2: The coach overurged the players to practice for hours on end, leading to exhaustion.
meanings.sent3: He overurged his dog to fetch the ball so many times that the poor pup got tired of playing.
meanings.sent4: The teacher overurged the students to study all night, as if their lives depended on it.
meanings.sent5: The parents overurged their child to finish all the vegetables on his plate, creating a battle at the dinner table.

meanings.definition: To push or drive someone to do something excessively.
meanings.sent1: The strict trainer overurged the athletes to run more miles than their bodies could handle.
meanings.sent2: She overurged her little brother to clean his room so many times that he finally snapped.
meanings.sent3: The enthusiastic friend overurged her buddy to watch every single episode of the TV show in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: The demanding boss overurged his employees to meet unrealistic deadlines, causing stress in the office.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious coach overurged the team to win every single game, pushing them beyond their limits.
